intro: Chaenorhinum villosum var. rodriguezii, commonly known as Rodriguez's hairy horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
